#Text=NYC students attempt to revive stoop culture
#Text=Saturday , February 17 , 2007
#Text=A trio of freshmen at a New York design school say that residents are n't taking advantage of a valuable and countless resource found all around the world : stoops .

#Text=In Sit Here , a campaign inspired by a recent class project , Sarah Feldman , Chelsea Briganti and Essence Rodriguez are using fliers placed around New York to encourage residents and visitors to get to know one another on their stoops .
#Text=This campaign aims to address the decreasing culture of social interaction formerly known as " Stoop Culture " .

column1: #Text=Wikinews got a chance to talk to Sarah Feldman , web designer for the project .
#Text=Feldman is also responsible for getting different news sources to contact the team , such as the Brooklyn Papers and New York Magazine .
#Text=When your group started this project , did you ever expect it would get this much publicity from the press and the public ?
#Text=We had no idea how popular this would become .
#Text=We just thought it was another usual school project we had to do .
#Text=The Brooklyn Record saw the topic about our website I posted on a Park Slope message board .
#Text=They talked about it and put our URL on their site .
#Text=Then The Brooklyn Papers found us on the Brooklyn Record .
#Text=A lot of press found us because of the article in the Brooklyn Papers .
#Text=We did n't know if it was just the Internet that caused all the fuss , but then a blogger on OnlyTheBlogKnowsBrooklyn and some photographer on Flickr found our fliers !
#Text=You originally started this project in New York City .
#Text=If you could run this project in any other city ( or country ) in the world , which one would it be , and why ?
#Text=Feldman
#Text=I 'd run this project in my hometown , Houston .
#Text=Now there you will find few people outside .
#Text=For one thing , it is hot and we are known for one of the most obese cities in the USA .
#Text=Houston has also coined the term " The Driving City " : no walking ... just driving .
#Text=If you ask my friends there , " Hey ... you wan na go outside and sit ? "
#Text=They 'd look at you funny and say " Ca n't we just go see a movie or go on Facebook ? "
#Text=Your fliers are bright green , which makes them very noticeable .
#Text=Out of the thousands of people who see your fliers each day , how many people do you think actually sit down and talk ?
#Text=Not enough .
#Text=Most of the time the people who I saw sitting were either outside of a bar or kids playing ball .
#Text=But I rarely saw any kids except on Sundays in Park Slope outside .
#Text=Probably they were watching TV or on the Internet .
#Text=Chelsea noticed this first .
#Text=She came up with the idea when she saw an elderly man sitting on his stoop by himself .
#Text=She started talking to him about his life there and he brought up the topic of less socialization with neighbors .
#Text=Sit Here has been noticed in at least 15 different news sources , including Wikinews .
